page.title: 03CALDWELL
page.content: Caldwell is a small hamlet in the heart of the country.It is mainly a farming community,with at least four farm yards opening onto the one main road.Caldwell hall,once the lord of the manor's residence is now a school for maladjusted children.Caldwell also has a small light engineering firm called Colbere Engineering,employing local people.There is one puplic house the Royal Oak parts of which are thought to be 300 years old.There is a small development of new houses,with planning permission for extension of the site. Caldwell has no shops or Post Office,the nearest being at Rostiston.St.Giles church,is an interesting building which is thought to date back to Anglo saxon & Norman times.Some of the old stained glass windows have been removed to protect them from damage caused by subsidence.
